TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Not meaning to sound dumb, but what is the "spam-o-matic"?

I personally like my spam grilled and served under a bed of scrambled eggs with sharp cheddar cheese and some Tabasco sauce. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-07T23:26:57Z" title="12/07/2015 11:26  PM" data-short="8 yr">December 7, 2015</time> by adsii1970**

Spamomatic is a service that maintains lists of email accounts, user names, and IPs that have been used by spammers. Once placed on the list, any more post submissions from that identity are blocked. I believe blocked for all Spamomatic participants, but I'm not sure about that part.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> Heh, I changed all my streams to condensed view a while back. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> If you want to ignore certain forums, make a new stream, under content types select "Topics", then under the gear icon select all forums but those you wish to ignore.
> 

Could you be more specific? I cannot find the word "Topics" on any page in the forums I go to.

Oh, Ok. makes sense to me. We had to do that in one of the forums I moderated for for SimCity. The only problem we ran into with the IP addresses is that if the original spammer used Internet access from a university, library, or other public area, and we blocked the IP address, we would often (and unavoidably) block access to those with legitimate accounts that had the same IP as the offending party. Now granted, that was about four years ago, so I am assuming that different protocols are in place or are you using a combination of IP, user name, and email addresses?

We even tried shady looking email domains, but because a large number of our spammers had either Yahoo! or Excite email addresses, we could not place that entire email domain on the rejection list...
